items.title: Bosses are fighting a new battle in the RTO wars: It’s not about where you work, but when you work
items.description: Burnout has moved from a state of place to a state of mind.

items.title: Trump snatches Maduro but leaves his regime in charge for now
items.description: For now, there’s no plan spelled out to have American troops or administrators in Venezuela.

items.title: Before Maduro arrest, Nobel Prize winner said Venezuela has a $1.7 trillion opportunity to privatize over 500 companies and undo socialist ‘disaster’
items.description: Venezuela has the world’s largest oil reserves, but “our people don’t even have gas even to cook. That’s a disaster,” María Corina Machado told Fortun...

items.title: Deploying U.S. troops in Venezuela could become a ‘force protection nightmare’ amid potential insurgency threat, retired colonel warns
items.description: "The risk with Venezuela is that it could be a hostile environment as well, and that could put U.S. forces in great danger."

items.title: Countries must move beyond seeing AI as a race, where one side must beat the other
items.description: When it comes to AI, cooperation between countries can yield greater benefits than working alone.
